Increased productivity: Without the need for sleep, individuals would be able to work around the clock, leading to increased productivity and efficiency in various industries. This-saying would also translate to the society whole, much more accomplished in a shorter amount of time.

Improved mental health: Sleep is essential for mental health and well-being. Without it, individuals would be more prone to stress, anxiety, and depression. This would lead to a society that is less mentally healthy and more prone to mental illness.

Increased social interaction: Sleep is often seen as a time to rest and recharge. Without it, individuals would have much more time to spend with friends and family, leading to increased social interaction and stronger relationships.

Shift in societal norms: The concept of a 24-hour workday would become the norm, leading to a shift in societal norms and expectations. This would also translate to a society that values productivity and efficiency above all else.

Environmental impact: The increased productivity and efficiency would lead to a society that consumes more resources and more waste. This would have a significant impact on the environment a whole, as resources and waste would increase at an unsustainable rate.
